poem:
A Dance in Spangled Light  

In PVC trousers,  
Pete, a comet, spins—  
spangly threads defying gravity,  
floating like a whispered dream.  

Sarah's Charleston hops,  
feet teasing the floor—  
briefly, a kiss,  
a perfect embrace of earth,  
before the air calls back  
its dancers,  
swaying in  
the uncharted pull  
of an unrepenting rhythm.
